Description: Foot and tondo sherd of black-glazed pottery open vessel (bolsal? cup-skyphos?); interior black; exterior: top of foot reserved with three black lines (one at edge); edge and resting surface of foot reserved; inside wall of foot black; underside reserved and smooth with two small black circles in centre and a pale red line near edge. Graffito on underside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (no. 109)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 705, no. 632)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1426)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
